Nightshift now knew why the tower had fired on him and his comrades.  It wa=
s no longer under Maximal control.  It would be a situation that Tucson cou=
ld never handle on his own no matter how strong he is now and how determine=
d he is to set things right.  But being clever was something Nightshift was=
 famous for.  He radios back to Polarclaw via text message.

" Guess what, =
I know why this tower dissed us.  It's been infested with those giant ugly =
aft bugs that we ran into at the jungle location.  Brute force might not wo=
rk but germ warfare will.  See if you guys can drum up someth'n about insec=
tile viruses, and see where we might find out how ta spread one and where t=
a find the virus spores.  Viruses can spread faster than we can storm a com=
plex, and wipe out an entire colony once an outbreak is established."

He t=
hen turns to the honey comb like structure.

" I hate bugs.  And after this=
, the only bugs I wanna see are the ones I can squash under my paws!"

--- =
In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>

<OLD>
> >
> > Nightshift narrows his eyes and gives a feline hiss of dislik=
e.
> >
> > " I knew we should've called an exterminator, when these bugs fi=
rst showed
> > up!  Ohh now I get it, you want this planet all to yourself,=
 right?  As if!
> > Do ya know how many baddies want this planet?!  You and=
 two other factions!
> > Better stand in line and wait your turn!  You'll b=
e wait'n a couple of vorns
> > before you get your share!"
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> =
There was a small chuckle of laughter over NIGHTSHIFT's radio, "Ahh,
> you =
are still living in your petty bickerings."
> 
> As the voice of the queen =
spoke the drone troopers brought NIGHTSHIFT
> up to the highest level of CR=
YONOSIS, to an area that looked as if it
> was once an observatory of some =
sort.
> 
> "But don't you realize that some things have grown larger than y=
ou,
> larger than even this planet?" The voice sounded tired again. "You ar=
e
> such small creatures."
> 
> As NIGHTSHIFT and BATSCOUT arrived the room=
 looked as if it had been
> cleared out. On the floor Where once there shou=
ld have been computer
> banks and consoles, there was appeared to be a larg=
e honeycomb like
> structure with a single large opening in the center of i=
t.
> 
> It looked like a hive.
> 
> "We have heard the calls." The queen's =
voice said. "And now, at last,
> we are ready to answer."
> 
> The hive lik=
e structure in the center of the room began to glow a
> strange orange colo=
r and  began to pulse with power. Above the room
> the ceiling of the room =
rumbled and then began to open, much like an
> observatory might, letting i=
n frigid winds from the outside and snow
> began to whip around the room.
>=
 
> Outside the revealed skies looked dark and angry, lightning began to
> =
strike as thunder boomed!
> 
> The twin insectile troopers stood silently w=
atching NIGHTSHIFT and
> BATSCOUT with cold impassive eyes seemingly immune=
 to the chaos of the
> snows and the storm.
>
